questions: I am always hungry, I must always be fed, The finger I touch, Will soon turn red
Gentle enough to soothe the skin, Light enough to caress the sky, Hard enough to crack rocks.
Say my name and I disappear. What am I?
Alive without breath, As cold as death, Clad in mail never clinking, Never thirsty, ever drinking
I build up castles. I tear down mountains. I make some men blind, I help others to see. What am I?
I know a word of letters three. Add two, and fewer there will be!
When set loose I fly away and those surrounding will go astray
I can be long, or I can be short. I can be grown, and I can be bought. I can be painted, or left bare. I can be round, or square. What am I?
I’m full of holes, yet I’m full of water. What am I?
What has a neck and no head, two arms but no hands?
Feed me and I live, give me drink and I die. What am I?
What goes around and around the wood but never goes into the wood?
What would you die without, walk through, and not see
I go around in circles, But always straight ahead
